text: Leadership only cares about the current contract and not where employees will be in 5 or 10 years.  They say they want to build a team and teach new skills when they hire you but it never happens.
cons: Only as good as you have a contract to work under.

text: I enjoy working at Leidos.  The benefits are good and the opportunity for personal growth is excellent.  Leidos has a great culture which allows each employee to pursue their goals.

Leidos is a great company to be a contractor for.  Great hours, telework opportunities and no micromanagmenet.  They do give you an opportunity to take classes if you want to learn something related to your job position.  The culture is very laid back.
cons: Not off on on all federal holidays

text: Regardless of your experience level, if you contribute high quality work, you are self motivated, and you seek additional responsibility, you will be valued and supported.
Leidos is a good company to work for. There is possibility to advance but the pay for lower ranked jobs can be lower than the average.
The company split into SAIC and Leidos.  Each taking some employees and locations.  It was very good to work at SAIC/Leidos
pros: Like to travel and many contracts allowed for this

text: *Since becoming an employee, most of my newly acquired knowledge pertains to the particular environment and culture of the workplace.

As an intern, it took SAIC about 3 to 5 weeks to actually give me work to do. I am still grateful to be hired and all, but I wish I could have done more in the company to be able to put that on my resume. After I complained to HR about not getting work, they finally switched me over to a different manager where I did some work for 4 weeks
Excellent company to work for. I literally have nothing bad to say about SAIC. It's the type of job you hold for your whole life. Good benefits, good work, and good management.

location: Sandia National Laboratories, Kirtland AFB NM
text: SAIC is a good company to work for but not great if you are outside the McLean or State of Virginia area.  Working in New Mexico for SAIC left you feeling more like the red headed stepchild.  No events were ever planned for us out there while the McLean office would get all of the employee appreciation events etc.  Work was ok, being subcontracted to the DOE but not able to take advantage of any DOE privileges reserved for the actual employees.  Benefits were okay, although things were better before the change this year to HSA.
cons: no team activiities, no Christmas celebrations, etc

text: SAIC is a great place to work, for a large company is feels like a family environment. Great coworkers who work hard and are experts in their field. Great local leadership who will help you anyway they can.

So far they have been every patient with me as a military retiree transitioning into the civilian workforce.  My co workers and management are great and are flexible with work hours and teleworking schedule.
cons: Not sure yet, I have not been working here long enough

text: Given a second chance; onboarding was seamless; people cared about you.  There's a timeline on onboarding process to ensure that everything goes smoothly.

position: Senior Cyber Security Analyst / Team Lead
text: One of the most stressful places I have ever worked. The pace was extremely high, constant fires, 24/7 on call, etc. One major cause of the stress was under-staffing, which allowed for plenty of opportunity to grow and learn different technologies and skills.

Company culture in any company is hard to change especially when you are cyber security and trying to make decisions for best practices. I am paid to highlight security risks not, coddle to a bonus hunting mentality
SAIC is a very good company.
pros: really good but expensive benies. Really interesting but technically challenging.
cons: Many services shifted to employees and some elements of poor managemt.

text: Good work life balance with a thoughtful manager. Engaging and challenging work with a number of clients across every major government agency.
Cyber analyst
cons: managers have a hard time communicating

text: Good company to work for.  Managers take care of their people.  Great opportunities for networking within and outside of the company.  Lots of opportunities to change work locations to move around.
nothing out of the ordinary, good work environment, fellow employees were friendly, helpful and professional, work location was close to the house and flexible.

Good company benefits but, lots of additional duties outside your statement of work.  You end up being multiple positions titles so its like having two jobs but being paid for the primary one hired for.

Engility is a great place to be part of a team committed to our National Security Objectives.  The company has taken the time to invest in training and education of our team with a goal of providing the best support to the mission partner.
Worked with cutting edge technologies.  always challenged by managers to develop leading edge secure systems for our customers.

I've been with Booz for 4 years in October.  What can I say, the industry is changing and Booz has had to change with it.  They don't offer the robust retirement packages that they used to, but they do give you something.  Excellent if you're entering the work force from college or military.  If you don't make Lead Associate in 5 years, it's time to move on.  Think of it as a stepping stone; but absolutely put everything you have into it.  It MAY "pan - out" for you; as it has for many of my colleagues.  If you have a skill or passion for something that higher management deems a "new business vector," GET INVOLVED!  Volunteer to write proposals and do what it takes to get new business.  You can promote in as few as 3 years is you are ambitious/ have skills in the right thing.
pros: Awesome people to work with, young crowd, free coffee at the Booz offices
cons: you will never see the Booz offices because you will be sitting at the client location, health benefits are absolutely terrible, health care choices are Kaiser or some form of Aetna with a $6K anual out of pocket, I support a family of 4 kids so I'm actually looking because I can't afford the insurance

text: An outstanding company to work for, work is rewarding, Compensation is great. people are great. If you are a hard charger Booz allen Hamilton is rewarding.

position: Senior Consultant, Cyber Security Sol Eng/Arch Mid
text: Management is great. Work environment is great. Office spaces are nice and clean and quiet. Everyone is very professional. The best company I have ever worked for. They interact well with customers. The pay is not great however.
pros: Management, co-workers, education benefit, room to move, opportunity to promote.
cons: Terrible pay. Healthcare coverage cost could be better.

text: Booz Allen has great management support from the home office for employees located at client sites.  Questions are answered quickly and the entire Booz Allen network is geared toward helping employees to be successful.
pros: Good Support System, They try to convey a feeling of teamwork
cons: Compensation may not be as good at other places

text: Good company to work for. Many open positions to apply to and great management. I have a great management home team that has helped me grow in my field.

I've worked at BAH for over 7 years and it's been one of the most rewarding experiences I've had. While there are drawbacks, there are drawbacks in every job. One cool thing about BAH is that if you want a change, you can usually find another team to that has something new and interesting going on.
pros: Free coffee, work from home opportunities
cons: Talkers are prompted quickly while introverts tend to get overlooked, you bring in business for your boss not yourself

text: The environment will push you beyond your comfort zone. Must be a team player. Be willing to learn to consult for different clients and transfer to the company's capabilities
pros: Job security, great mentorship program, ability to grow your career in any field
cons: Sometimes long hours, having to work outside of your area

text: no complaints about this company, great firm to work at. the company look for you to advance and what to see you advance in your career. they believe in people.
Client focused organization- experience is shaped by management team. Medical and healthcare benefits are not as competitive as they once were years ago.
Enjoyed my 5+ years working for cyber security tasks for various clients.  Booz Allen management and culture are very professional and attentive to employee needs, desires, etc.
Good company. Job security. There is always a new open position for internal hire. Will keep you on overhead if contract ends.
This company is a great starting point for entry into the life of a consultant.  Great salary and excellent benefits.  The technical skills of the employees is unmatched.

position: Lead Associate - SME Cyber Security ICS
text: Good pay and benefits. Focus on new cyber security issues in Industrial Control environments creates opportunity to build out a new service.
pros: Working with great people with excellent skills
cons: Corporation focus on short term billable goals creates culture of fear for job stability.

text: Competitive environment!

Booz does management consulting. Management consulting, the practice of helping organizations to improve their performance, operates primarily through the analysis of existing organizational problems and the development of plans for improvement. Organizations may draw upon the services of management consultants for a number of reasons, including gaining external (and presumably objective) advice and access to the consultants' specialized expertise.

Booz Allen Hamilton was a great company to work for. I have nothing bad to say about Booz Allen. I only left the company in order to stay with the customer that I had been working with and to allow my family to stay in the same location for more longer than two years after getting out of the Marine Corps.
Nice place to work. I enjoy spending time with my work mates.

As a Senior Information Assurance Cyber Security Professional with 18 years’ experience working in critical program enclaves and test environments, I have overseen, evaluated, and developed the documentation, validation, certification and accreditation (C&A) processes necessary to assure that new information technology (IT) systems meet the organization’s requirements.
Booz Allen Hamilton is a excellent firm to work for. Benefits are good excellent ethics program, salary and compensation

I've been with NGC for approximately 18 years.   I very much like the company and feel at home here.  Not too many opportunities for mid-career professionals.  Big push to hire and retain millennials.   Once you reach top of salary in your position  don't expect any raises or promotions.  Besides that overall great company to work for.
cons: No opportunity for advancement if you are mid-career

text: Northrop Grumman is more than a defense contractor and has grown IT services and technologies agressively since the early 2000's. In my experience Northrop did suffer from have non-technical managers leading engineers and developers especially in the IT segments of the company.  Northrop Grumman's Cyber services are also constantly changing which can be confusing to it's employees and perspective clients.

I worked as a cyber security intern at the BWI campus. I was able to be exposed to new technologies which expanded my ability. All employees that I interacted with made themselves available to provide guidance for my career. I enjoyed my time here over the summer.

position: Cyber Security Analyst II, Missile Defense Agency
text: I really enjoying working for NGC and think that the environment that is fostered is really positive for the employee. The company offers competitive benefits and growth opportunities.
Northrop Grumman is one of the best companies to work for when it comes to IT. Plenty of expansion and growth and always something new and exciting projects to work on.
As a cyber systems security engineer, I am responsible for running continuous monitoring scans utilizing Nessus to find and analyze vulnerabilities in the system.
A great place to work with a generous benefits package.  I would recommend Northrop Grumman to anyone looking for a rewarding career in IT.
The work was challenging, but satisfying. Management was very supportive, and encourage professional growth and development.

Everyone are true professionals and the atmosphere is always healthy. There is always someone willing to help you learn something new in our field of work. Our leadership is always available and willing to provide any guidance needed.

position: CYBER FORENSIC SPECIALIST / CYBER SECURITY ANALYST
text: Great company, but roles are limited to contrating.  Great 401k only if you invest in it.  They always seem to be looking but they don't respond to your submissions.
typical day at work
Outstanding company to work for and being a member of a wining team. I have work for Northrop Grumman for 21 years on many part of the globe. I am very proud of this company and their products.
Flexible Work Schedule, decent benefits. Just like most of the other defense contractors out there.
cons: sometimes work long hours very little or usually no overtime pay.

text: Easy transition from military service to contracting world. Company has outlined career paths which provides clear means to advance or seek experience in technical or management tracks. Opportunity for growth is there, but relocation may be necessary dending on the specific site needs.
cons: Isolated work sites with minimal contact with other company collegues.

text: A nice place to work that offers plenty of opportunities to work on interesting projects as well as work with pleasant people. Overall it was an eye-opening experience.

position: Network Engineer - DoD Cyber Security Range
text: I have learned that long hours and dedication can burn you out.  None the less, the skills that I acquired while there are priceless.  I can also appreciate my colleagues for building a family environment.
Benefits are good for the industry trend.  Compensation is average.  Work environment is all over the place depending on managers and contract.  I was....
Great place to work with good balance of work and home life.  Excellent support from middle and upper level managers.  Would be happy to take a position with them wherever life takes me.
Not a good experience. it depends on contract work awarded to ManTech which you can not control. But if the contact is extended then you will have job or otherwise you are asked to leave.
Many ManTech employees work in Department of Defense facilities as opposed to ManTech facilities.  ManTech provides excellent benefits and encourages employee self-improvement activities.
Learning everyday on the job. The most enjoyable part of my job is providing support to the warfighter.
It is absolutely annoying that this is a necessary and unavoidable step that I am require to take. One should absolutely be able to skip this if that is what they elect.

Its a great place to work, there are a lot of opportunities at Raytheon if you know where to look. Management consists of some people are more experts in their field rather than actual leaders, which does present some issues from time to time, but everyone is good spirited.

Day to day I interact with users to fulfill various requests. from adding or removing equipment, adding or removing users from areas and other security related jobs functions. I've learned how to carry myself in a professional setting and improved my IA/IT knowledge greatly. The management is determined to help you grow and seek better opportunities as they like to promote within the company. The culture at Raytheon is to increase the diversity and inclusiveness of their employees. Difficulties in the workplace would include maintaining compliance with the NISPOM CH.8 and ensuring users are following security requirements. The enjoyable parts of the job are interacting with users and admins to resolve issues and creating a holistic work environment.

position: IT Security, Sr. Governance and Risk Specialist
text: I work in IT. Great job security, advancement opps & supportive leadership. Great co-workers & work environment. Been there 13yrs, will likely retire from this company.
pros: Great people; dynamic work environment, excellent benefits, pay & raises and flexible work schedule.
cons: None that I can think of...

text: Raytheon is a great company to work for and has a lot of potential for career growth. Opportunities are available for a variety of fields and locations. I have been in a position where there is no typical day, cyber security is an ever evolving field and the teams that I work with have learned to adjust on an almost daily basis. Co-workers are hard working, smart, and value the importance of the final product.  Our products help protect and advise people in a variety of scenarios.  The most enjoyable part is knowing there is a new challenge right around the corner, never a dull moment.
This company offers many opportunities to gain experience and develop your skills.  Tons of different job positions available across many areas of interest.
pros: Big corporation has lots of opportunities
cons: Big corporation salary advancement is difficult

text: Innovative culture with exciting work
Very flexible work schedule and good group of people in general to work with on a daily basis.

Analyzed the tasks and interactions performed by various Engineering departments, how their products and processes affected one another, the impact on non-engineering processes, and determined value added practices. Based on this methodology, proposed a Documentation Road Map that detailed the relationships and priority flow down of the standards, policies and guidelines for each department.
Good company to work for, many opportunities for other work. Friendly work environment and good management. Benefits were not bad. People here made the job enjoyable.
I wish I was a little lamb, little lamb, little lamb. There once was a man from Nantucket. I like turtles. Hello? Is anybody out there? Can anyone hear me?
I had my own office and supported the Base Communications squadron. I supported multiple agencies and learned from my  customers as we worked together as a team.
cons: Distance to my job from my home.

text: I liked where I worked.  The people in my team were fantastic.  However, even within the Security Team as a whole, it was a dog-eat-dog world.  That and lack of cross training and pay advancement made me leave.  However, if offered a job there again, I would come back.
It was fun to go to work

Worked12 hour days on panama schedule with great people and learned a lot. During the weekend or holidays we would have a pot luck and a movie marathon.  Close knit group of people who tried to make the best of the long hours we spent at work.
cons: 12 hour days and lack of advancement

text: GDIT is a great organization to work for.  Given the size of the organization you cant really say how great the management team is because your team will more than likely be different.  Executive management does a outstanding job laying out business goals and directives.  I work with people from a multitude of contracts and business environments so it provides a great connecting experience.  The only con would be that salary typically slightly below market.

The benefits are not great but at least there are health, eye and dental coverage which is more than a lot of companies provide now days. Compensation isn't particularly competitive but the opportunities to learn and gain knowledge make working for this company worth it. Certain departments and teams have a great reputation and continue to win work. There is a lot of turn over and growth but employees that don't ask for/seek out recognition continuously are often lost in the shuffle.
pros: experienced, win contracts, lots of business won
cons: lousy healthcare, long hours, salary increases without promotion minimal

text: Incident response
Dealt with some severe management at this company. Things are/have turned around, but slowly...

Daily work include incident response to Arcsight cases, responding to potential PII breach, investigating suspicious and malicious traffic alerts sent by Sourcefire and monitoring Arcsight dashboards for trending alerts.
Solid benefits and good management. CACI has been one of the best contracting companies I've worked for. As a contractor I won't be able to answer anything about the corporate culture.

I'm pretty impressed by the CEO, who walks his walk...pay is one of the best in the defense contracting companies...they are flexible to work with you if you want to move around....overall a great company.  I must say, it is one of the best defense contracting company I've ever worked for in my 15 years in IT.

CACI takes pride in hiring skilled and knowledgeable workers. The company offers many internal advancement and transition opportunities, and they appreciate and hold on to talent when they find them. The benefits are great and the environment is also pretty awesome. It's a company focused on exceptionalism, and if you appreciate that kind of thing you would fit in well. Work hard and play hard, it's the best employer I've ever worked for.
Management dislocated.  Human Resources was hard to engage and get response in a timely fashion.  Salary and benefits are good.   Supportive manager.  Pleasant coworkers.

I can't really discuss my work at this time, however; I find it very rewarding and enjoy the job.  My supervisors and co-workers are great to work with and make my work enjoyable.  We are able to learn from one another.  The hardest part of my job is not having enough time in the day to complete everything I would like to get done.  I enjoy assisting our customers and I can tell they are very pleased at the service I provide them.
pros: working in the information security field.
cons: Not enough time to complete some tasks.

text: In a typical work day as a contractor I work with customers that are in every branch of the Military, along with government employees and other contractors as well. I have learned that being contractor has its pros and cons as any other job just without all the stress. I enjoy working for management as they give us the tools we need for success. I get along with all of my coworkers as we provide support as needed. My most enjoyable time is being part of a team that cares for the customer.
cons: being a contractor from year to year

text: CACI has good benefits as far as 401K/Tuition go and job hours can be flexible and pleasant depending on management and location. Hardest part of my job is the environment that I work in which is filled with bureaucratic nonsense that can prevent you from doing your job and unrealistic workloads that are dumped on you. I don't have alot of interaction with CACI HQ or senior leadership so guidance can be lacking. Also, if the government cuts back you are faced with the possibility of moving or finding other employment (internal/external) if money can not be awarded to further fund contracts.
cons: work environment, management, mundane work at times, contracting

text: CACI is my first dive into the area of eDiscovery. I have worked criminal cases all of my career and now am working with a lot of civil litigation. Because of this, I am working with a different mind set and this is very interesting. CACI is a very large contracting firm and there is great pressure to have 'billable' hours for anytime that you are in the office. There has recently been a re-organization at the leadership level of the company and this has brought about quite a few changes. Many of the top level managers have either been released or have been demoted. This has been done to try to streamline the business in lieu of the government budget cuts.
cons: leave benefits are in need of increase

text: Fast-paced work environment that allows me to grow as an IT professional. Wonderful management that cares about their employees growth. Every part of the job is enjoyable.
just reviewed this company in a previous window. CACI san Antonio is great, great leadership, great people, great mission, great view from the office windows
Perform scans as needed on company systems. Use Assured Compliance Assessment Solution "ACAS" to perform security assessments. Validate settings with Network Mapper "NMAP".
Wonderful atmosphere with very intelligent and easy to get along with individuals.
Great agency. Great leadership. Great mission. Great for self-development. Great technical training. Great co-workers. Great facilities. Great location.
Seems that the management is definitely chosen by favorites. Great workers, but that doesn't mean you should be a manager. Definitely ruined my experience here!

A fairly busy work environment during day, work here will certainly keep you going. Never a dull moment, to say the least. Management really needs to look at the needs of the individual employees, as it lacks empathy...for the most part. The hardest part of the job is dealing with management when you are doing the best that you can, but don't get the feedback and accollades that you deserve.
cons: perceived job security, failure to communicate employee rights

text: Hours were flexible. As long as you were there by 9:00 and stayed until 3:00, there weren't any issues. If you couldn't make it in or needed to leave for a bit during the day, they would work with you. We were given tasks and challenges to improve our skills and to learn new skills and techniques. Everybody there was willing to help us interns with any issues or questions that we had, and we were given a lot of freedom when completing our tasks. Our supervisors would periodically check in on us and give us advice, but it was always done respectfully and never made me feel inferior. The full-time employees mentoring us appeared to be given projects to work on in their own way (pen testing systems and such) through whatever reasonable means needed to achieve their goal. I acquired skills such as writing scripts in a few languages, with Python being a prominent one. The hardest part of the job, and the most enjoyable, was figuring out what angle(s) were best suited for a particular task. Each project was a puzzle with several potential ways of solving it. There was almost always more than one was to solve the puzzle, it just depended on your skill set and mindset as to which angles you wanted to try first.
pros: Flexible hours, good work environment, good pay
cons: The internship felt a little short

text: System High has been recognized as the provider of choice for innovative security engineering. Delivering high-end information protection services, over 50% of the security professionals are US Military veterans. Patriotism, commitment to excellence, and successful mission accomplishment permeate the corporate culture. Whether designing or constructing secure facilities (SCIFs), performing IT systems certification and accreditation, establishing regulatory compliant corporate security programs, or producing life-cycle protection planning for complex systems acquisitions. System High has the expertise and tools to facilitate mission success.

The overall focus of Parsons is client satisfaction with a focus on good project management. The most enjoyable part of the job is being given the opportunity to work in areas that are challenging as well as personally/professionally rewarding. The biggest drawback is their ability to find talented personnel new opportunities once projects are completed. While this is an indirect factor in many project management based firms, a 'bench' for more of their better performers would be beneficial.

I was hired right out of the Navy and was grateful to have the opportunity to continue in the IT field as a contractor. Unfortunately my project manager lacked professionalism. threatening physical harm because of the way i wore my hair.
This position was adequate for what I was looking for at the time.  The company as a whole is great to work for with excellent benefits.  Each section of the company has pros and cons though.
I was hired on the job site, and had no inter action with the company
Lot's of opportunities to grow and great benefits.  The provided me with the tools to further my career.  Would highly recommend this company to job seekers
Great firm for someone who has lot of drive and desires to learn. The culture here promotes merit and one will get to work with highly talented set of peers.

Great team of people to work with.  Depending on the project a significant amount of travel may be required.  Company not afraid to tackle challenges and provide the best possible solutions to the companies they work with.
Politics override performance, skills and technical knowledge.  I had the highest possible review with PWC then 5 months later was released without a real reason.

position: Cyber Security, Privacy and Risk Consultant
text: I encountered only the best people at PwC. Great place to work for top performers!  One of the only Big 4 consulting companies that truly understands how to create a flexible and humanistic work culture for a demanding career.
This is was a great internship experience in order to get to know the cyber security and technology consulting landscape.
If you are that social savvy person, this is the place for you. Your position in the company is a small business owner. You have to be a social savvy to find a good project.
pros: Great culture, learn a lot, fast pace.
cons: You have to kiss a** sometimes.

text: It's a great place to work but be forewarned that the work/life balance is tough if you want to advance. Other than that, most of the benefits are better than the average company.

The culture here is amazing. Work hard but play hard is the best way I can explain it. Some of the best training I've ever had. The ITS Helpdesk team is very helpful. You are in charge of your own career here which is awesome.
Deloitte is a great work environment, if you get on the right team and well managed projects. The consulting environment is not suited to every individual.
cons: Hard to implement changes to methodologies

text: Employees at Deloitte are really nice and are willing to go out of their way to help you and see you succeed. Regardless of the position or the seniority of the employee. They are all willing to help you and there are so much resources to utilize at the firm.
Fly out on Sunday or Monday and fly home Thursday or Friday.  Wash clothes, pay bills and do it all again.

MUFG Union Bank is trying to grow rapidly with unqualified, untrained leadership, inefficient processes, and silo mentality.  The result is a cesspool of toxicity and frustration that makes it a challenging place to work.  Management is unrealistic on expectations - easy place to burnout quickly.
9 hours of working per day. The environment and team mates are pretty encouraging. Your learning curve increases as the development projects upgrades and use the latest industry technologies.
•	Daily analysis and translation of reports and their application to department requirements and assurance of there functional specifications
Attend meetings, discussed remediation, vulnerabilities and process and risks to stakeholders.
PepsiCo, Inc. is the overarching company that manages 22 one-billion dollar companies.  The brand consists of Frito Lay, Quaker, Tropicana, Gatorade, and, of course, Pepsi.

KeyW does not have any opportunities for employees to move laterally. The employee mobility program is a complete and utter joke that does not serve it's purpose. As a cleared, cybersecurity professional, it is quite worrisome to not have any mobility within the company. Make sure you are on a long-term contract or else the company won't know what to do with you after your contract ends.
cons: Management is unaware of employee mobility issues

text: Strong team oriented, strong values, strong mission statement and is very dedicated to the communities that we serve.  Company is environmentally friendly, focused on improving out communities.

I was brought in for a project (IT).  I had a couple of managers during that time and liked them both.  They hired me on as a full-time worker, but then (one at a time) project members left.  (This was from attrition or their contracts expiring.)  By the time I left, I was attempting to do the work that was previously being done by several others.  It just became too much.

position: Information Security Analyst & IAM SSO Consultant
text: UHG (Optum for I.T.)  is a Fortune 10 and although they're an elite healthcare company, they're health insurance is quite lacking.  I do regret leaving though.
cons: Management changes frequently and if not, you can be shuffled around frequently

position: IT Security- Identity & Access Management Analyst
text: The company I was once employed was bought out by another company. After 19 years of service I was laid off due to downsizing by the new company......
pros: Ability to work remotely 2 days a week

text: Business hours are reasonable
It is a big compnay, with minimal benefits and compensation.No room to grow. but very friendly workers and relax environment
pros: Call Center so lots of social events
